name: Le Meridien Nice

reviews.text: We only stayed one night and didn't have any meals other than breakfast. We arrived early but the hotel was very good in getting our room ready very quickly. The rooms were very nice however the 'balcony' I paid extra for was not big enough for a chair so you could only stand on it. When you book be careful to get the proper balcony/terrace otherwise it is a bit of a waste of money. Breakfast was prompt and we got everything we ordered, however the cooked food was barely warm so I would just stick to the continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. The reason we booked it was I was in Nice a few weeks before on a girls trip and we had cocktails on the terrace which enticed me to return with my partner.
reviews.title: Do not pay 4 star prices for a 2 star hotel with poor attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival check in was smooth - however, I had emailed the hotel in advance advising I had read a few reviews on the hotel that was cause for concern and could they assure me of a 4 * accommodation. I reminder her of this and she said they received my email and gave me a suitable room.
reviews.title: This isi not a 4 star hotel..Dingy odor hallways..falsely depicted on website Tiny rooms! te

reviews.text: When we got to the room I can honestly say I have seen better in a Travel Lodge. The room was dated, smelling of " shake & vac", plastic bedside table, air conditioning cool to warm at BEST ! No tea of coffee making facilities - shabby corridors poor poor poor - not like the photos on their website.
reviews.title: Great location. Good hotel

reviews.text: I returned to reception and expressed my concerns and they said I could upgrade for an extra £150 euros per night - OMG !!!! I explained that since I had reads the reviews (after booking) and I didn't feel I had a four star room what could they offer - NOTHING was the response. Audrey on reception basically said - if I new there were problems - why did I book it. Can you believe that.
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.text: Loved the location. Prime spot with easy access to beach and old town nice. The hotel is a busy beach hotel. The rooms were sizeable, compared to similarly priced rooms in Paris, and clean. Bathroom was large with a combo shower/bathtub, toilet and bidet all in same room. Plenty of towels. Bedroom had a large tv, dining table with chair and bench seating. Small balcony over looking the small street behind the hotel. Breakfast in the hotel was great - eggs any style, omelets, crepes, toast, fruit, cereal, cheese, coldcuts, bacon, sausage (huge buffet) for Euro 22. Everything was clean and staff was pretty friendly and obliging. Air conditioning worked well. The only thing that bothered me was that street noise was significant while we were trying to sleep (we went to bed fairly early given I was with a 3 yr old and 6 yr old). The pool is small and deep and surrounded by walls, gate and a small deck area with a few lounge chairs. Outside the gate is a restaurant/bar with tables and lounge chairs if you want to sunbathe.
reviews.title: Great location, Above Average Hotel

reviews.text: I would stay here again. I can't imagine a better location.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from Nice and stayed at Le Meridian Nice. The hotel was very nice and the staff was absoutely wonderful. They recommended great restaurants and were very accomodating. If i ever go back to Nice, I will definitely stay there. I recommend this hotel to everyone going to Nice. it's located within walking distance from all the great sites and beach.
reviews.title: Solid four-star in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PS--bring water shoes for the beach as it is very rocky!
reviews.title: This hotel is unfit to hold the Le Meridien name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Meridien Nice for three nights at the end of May, prepared for substandard lodging based on others’ reviews. Because we wanted to stay at an SPG property, however, we were left with very few choices in Provence (we also stayed at the Meridien Beach Plaza in Monte Carlo during our trip). Our stay was actually great.
reviews.title: Fine, but nothing to write home about

reviews.text: Ok so this was probably the least 'decadent' Le Meridien that I have stayed in but not withstanding that it is still a good place to stay. We stayed for 5 days and had a sea-view room which was actually quite large and we certainly did not encounter any smells anywhere in the hotel. I give this hotel an above average rating because of the location, it is right in the middle of everything very easy access to the old and new town, main bus routes and major car rental authorities are right behind this hotel. Yes you have to pay for the private beach but that is standard wherever you go, and for the price (15 Euros) you get more then what you do at other private beaches on the strip. I did not see one thing to complain about in this hotel so I am not sure what the bad reviews are for. I do agree it is a bit overpriced but you try to find a cheap place to stay on the main promenade. The beds and linens are heavenly and the rooms are kept very clean... I would definitely stay here again!!!
reviews.title: Location is key!
Over priced and shabby
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Meridien for 4 nights in August for our honeymoon. We found the hotel very expensive and shabby. The reception staff were not friendly and had no warmth at all when we mentioned it was our honeymoon. We moved rooms 3 times as the first 2 rooms were covered in black marks up the walls and on the carpets and stunk of damp in one and smoke in the other. The third room we moved to (at a price and with some tutting from reception) )was marginally better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The roof terrace/bar is lovely but very expensive (particularly when the waitress wonders off with your cash and then disappears, I assume going off shift - with your change!). It also closes around 10 pm which was annoying and not what you would expect from a 4 star hotel.
reviews.title: Thank God

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were caught up in the airport disruption and had to check the internet at the hotel for flight information -10 Euros for 30 mins - daylight robbery!!
reviews.title: Gorgeous French Hotel!!!

likes.disliked: — Try emailing the hotel direct with questions/concerns, and be polite. It might even get you an upgrade! It did for us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we found ourseleves unable to get a flight home we decided not to stay at the Meridien but to move. We stayed at the Mecure (which is in the same building!) which was abit like a Travelodge but was clean, reasonably priced and shared the same great location. Reception were helpful too which made a refreshing change.
reviews.title: Lovely, but very pricey!

reviews.text: Well positioned, clean, well sound proofed rooms and boasting a great roof top pool terrace.
reviews.title: On The Take

reviews.text: However, The main problem with this hotel is the fact that it's 'on the take' from the minute you get there (don't bother with the Bell Boy - he takes ages, I got quite bored sitting in my room in silence waiting to unpack after a lengthy flight).
reviews.title: A Good Hotel for the Right Situation...
A Big Disappointment
reviews.text: Sun loungers & breakfast are both at an additional cost which I personally think is a bit cheeky.

Alcohol on site (Bar, restaurant, terrace & mini bar) is rediculously expensive (10.50 Euro for less than a pint of Kronenburg) (6 Euro a small bottle of Evian), as a result you see countless guests smuggling booze back to their rooms - meaning the bar (if you can afford it) was dead of atmosphere.
reviews.title: Never Again!
Hotel overall
reviews.text: Also, the reception staff were fairly unhelpful but irrratatingly syrupy with it.

Second time in Nice and not being a fan of the beach, was looking for a hotel with a pool. There aren't that many! Chose Le Meridien due to great location close to the old time and right on Promenade Des Anglais. The pool is on the roof, reasonable size, the roof terrace is lovely with sofas and dining area- a little bit scant on sun loungers- we would cheekily nab a couple before breakfast. View across the bay is beautiful.
reviews.title: Rooms only OK, but Terrace bar and pool fantastic

reviews.text: The rooms/interior is fairly old, not tatty, but definitely not new, but we weren't in the room too much, so wasn't a problem. We had a room that faced inwards and would think about upgrading to a sea view one next time.
reviews.title: What a Liberté

reviews.text: We had only one run in with a rude French receptionist man following some inaccurate information about the inclusion of breakfast in our rate (it was included in the main room,but not on the terrace), but raised the same issue later and it was dealt with very quickly and reception/staff were very helpful- think we just caught him on a miserable day! Breakfast in the main restaurant was great though- lots of everything- hot and cold and still well stocked even when we went late.
reviews.title: A great time in Nice

reviews.text: Oh my lord where to begin. Although it is conveniently situated on the Promenade des Anglais, it is important to note that so is virtually every other hotel in Nice as the promenade is an extremely long seafront road.
reviews.title: Needs a facelift and fewer ripoffs

reviews.text: My driver (an ex-Parisian who must have been expelled from the city because he was quite warm and charming) happily announced we had arrived. All I could see was a huge McDonalds and a Casino that looked more Atlantic boardwalk than Monte Carlo. You enter the hotel on its side and it never really got up from there. First you go through a strange Kew Gardenesque revolving door painted with strange plants. You are then faced with a rather tatty ground floor expanse of - er nothing much except an up and down escalator and a silver settee. When you reach the next floor the reception is at the top of a long lobby where there were many guests sitting around on their laptops. I wondered why they are not outside enjoying the sun or at least working in their rooms - later you find out that wireless network is only available in the lobby. And this from a 4* plus hotel. Lord even McDonalds give it for free but the Meridien charges 19 euro.
reviews.title: Safety Issues with this hotel - Be Aware

reviews.text: Despite other reviews mentioning odd smells, we didn't notice any. The room we were offered for our first night was a high/extra cost room and we were scheduled to move to a 'classic' room for our remaining three nights. After inspecting the classic room, we decided to stay in the more expensive room (#700) - despite costing an extra €100 initially (negotiated down to €50/night), it was worth it for the balcony and the view.
reviews.title: Reasonable stay, but very expensive 'extras'
Slightly disappointed
reviews.text: The pool area is nice, with excellent views from the roof-top - the charge of €10/bed for the day is outrageous and when coupled with the €8 charge to use the three fitness machines or an unbelievable €15 for the sauna makes you feel ripped-off by this establishment. Our bill for four nights was over €1,000 without any food, way too much for the class of hotel.

We enjoyed our stay but felt very over-charged. It's coloured my view of this chain and I will stick to Hilton's and Marriott's in future, especially since I have privilege levels in both those chains.
reviews.title: Hotel and Nice were fantastic ....
Cote d' Zure, Anyone ?
reviews.text: The location was excellent, breakfast great and the service was good but I thought that the hotel looked a bit tired and was therefore disappointed for the price we paid. I also thought that it was a rip off that we had to pay 10 euros per person per day just to lie by the pool (there was also a charge for the beach) - this should have been free for hotel guests. I don't know what the other hotels in Nice are like but I wouldn't go back to this one.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: This was a great hotel, we have just come back from a week's stay and we really enjoyed our time here, the hotel itself although not much to look at from the outside was quite different inside and was decorated to very high standards, the rooms were equally nice, we just went for a standard room facing the courtyard which was lovely but we did see the Suites facing the promenade and they looked great also.

I have just returned from Nice and stayed at the Le Meridiian hotel with my husband, daughter and son -in-law. I e-mailed the hotel direct and got exactly what we wanted. My daughter even got the same room as they stayed in last year for their honeymoon.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!

reviews.text: Staff are helpful and courtious and the de-luxe rooms we had on the 7th floor were fab!
reviews.title: better than expected, better than most reviews

reviews.text: Granted drinks and meals are expensive, but the swimming pool and terrace on the 9th floor make up for this.
reviews.title: It is a very good hotel (for nice)

reviews.text: Excellent hotel- would definately go again,
reviews.title: A sparking gem on the Cote D'Azur
horrible ... don't trust the website
reviews.text: I took 40 distributors from work to Nice last week and have little to complain about. yes it's expensive, but not compared to other Nice prices for rooms, or other Meridien prices for drinks, meals etc. Food very good - we had a special meal on the Ruhl beach one night and a buffet in the Colonial Cafe one lunchtime. Rooms were good and big enough for me. Would recommend it for the location, staff, and food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was perfect, right on the promenade and just steps across Nice's breathtaking beach. Then we checked into our hotel room and worst experience of any trip ever! OK that our rom had a view of the courtyard, hallways were dark and dingy, and that towels were scarce. But the STENCH in every part of our hotel room was so unbearable at times. The bathroom smelled like they cleaned with a dirty dish towel, water had bad odor both in toilet and sink, side of bathtub looked like it was covered w/ plywood (not sure what it was), paint peeled on walls, no shower liner(?), water ran everywhere... One morning, went down to breakfast, forgot something in room. Cleaning lady was just finishing up in bathroom when I returned. I realized then they don't CLEAN, they wipe down the sink and replace towels, and that's all. Awful! We tried to get another room, but they didn't have any so we were stuck for 3 nights. It was worst hotel experience ever.
reviews.title: Don't let the location fool you, worst hotel on the Promenade.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I are frequent travellers throughout Europe and the States. We often stay at the SPG and Hilton hotels because of their friendly points systems. We stayed with friends at the Le Meridien Nice for a long weekend in June and were a little disappointed on the overall experience and service at a Le Meridien property.
reviews.title: Sweltering in 713

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pluses: Fabulous location overlooking the promenade and smack in the center of all of the activity. Our room (713) was clean and well appointed and although it was a standard classic room was of avarage size for Europe. We did not feel "boxed in". The mattress and pillows were of good quality and quite comfortable for sleeping. The McDonalds Cafe which sits under the hotel does offer great coffee in the morning for a reasonable price as the rooms do not have coffee makers.
reviews.title: Great location and the price is right

reviews.text: To note: The prices for internet use was about 20 euro per day, breakfast buffet 22 euro (average) and a glass of very bad wine on the terrace 14 euro. It is not inexpensive but you are in Nice on the beach. The hotel's terrace does offer a wonderful view but the pool is quite small and filled with loud children during our stay so I would recommend the beach which is quite lovely. The hotel has an agreement with the beach and restaurant across the street for 21 euros per person. This will provide you with a beach lounge chair with cushion, towels and access to showers. The beach restaurant's food quality was very good and we ate there for lunch three days in a row. Ruhl Plage was the name of the restaurant/beach.
reviews.title: Stay Somewhere Else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Service is very spotty. I did not think anyone was purposefully being rude just apathetic in some cases and it did leave me wondering if the hotel staff would benefit from a course on customer service. The staff at breakfast was more intent on blocking off areas of the restaurant and clearing tables rather than actually answering requests for orders. Two mornings out of three we had to ask three different people for coffee and a croissant with a 20 minute wait. The terrace bar staff seemed very poorly organised and drinks arrived late and with the wrong items. We complained about the lack of airconditioning three times before they sent an engineer to the room. The first night we arrived they simply told us to call back in the morning as there was nothing they could do. After the engineer left the airconditioning still left a lot to be desired. When asked if we enjoyed our stay upon check out my husband told the desk manager that the airconditioning was not working properly in the room despite a visit from maintenance. The manager told my husband that "Americans find the European systems weak compared to their own but that this was normal for Europe." I held my tongue and did not tell him that our friends in 754 had a perfectly good system, we lived in London and are used to staying in European hotels and no this was NOT normal."
reviews.title: Perfect location, lovely rooms and facilities

description: At n°1 Promenade des Anglais, Le Méridien Nice is set in the perfect location, facing the sea, right in the centre of town. Featuring a a roof top terrace with the main restaurant "La Terrasse" offering a spectacular view and a taste of the Mediterranean and a heated swimming pool, the hotel also benefits from an indoor restaurants, "Le Colonial Café," in a relaxing lounge setting.
